member.name: M:Unigine.Light.setMode(Light::MODE)
member.summary: Sets rendering mode for the light source. This option determines whether the light is to be rendered as a dynamic or static one.
member.param: Light mode, one of the MODE_* variables.

member.name: M:Unigine.Light.getMode const
member.summary: Returns the current rendering mode for the light source. This option determines whether the light is to be rendered as a dynamic or static one.
member.returns: Light mode, one of the MODE_* variables.

member.name: M:Unigine.Light.setAttenuationPower(float)
member.summary: Updates the attenuation power of the light. This parameter determines how fast the intensity decreases up to the attenuation distance set for the light source. If the attenuation equals to zero or is close to it, the edge between illuminated and non-illuminated areas will be sharp.
member.param: Light attenuation power.

member.name: M:Unigine.Light.getAttenuationPower const
member.summary: Returns the attenuation power of the light. This parameter determines how fast the intensity decreases up to the attenuation distance set for the light source. If the attenuation equals to zero or is close to it, the edge between illuminated and non-illuminated areas will be sharp. The default is 1.
member.returns: Light attenuation power.

member.name: M:Unigine.Light.setColor(Unigine.Math.vec4)
member.summary: Updates the color of the light source. The method takes effect only when the Classic color mode is set.
member.param: New color in the RGBA format.

member.name: M:Unigine.Light.getColor const
member.summary: Returns the color of the light source. The default is opaque white, (1, 1, 1, 1). The method takes effect only when the Classic color mode is set.
member.returns: Color of the light source in the RGBA format.

member.name: M:Unigine.Light.getDepthTexture const
member.summary: Returns the current depth texture (shadow map) of the light source.
member.returns: Current depth texture (shadow map) of the light source.

member.name: M:Unigine.Light.getShadowColorTexture const
member.summary: Returns the current shadow texture of the light source used to render translucent shadows: G-channel stores depth values, R-channel - transparency values.
member.returns: Current shadow texture of the light source.

member.name: M:Unigine.Light.setFadeDistance(float)
member.summary: Updates a distance, at which the light gradually disappears. This parameter enables to render the light with decreasing radiance after the Visible distance is past.
member.param: Distance in units.

member.name: M:Unigine.Light.getFadeDistance const
member.summary: Returns the current distance, at which the light source gradually disappears. This parameter enables to render the light with decreasing radiance after the Visible distance is past.
member.returns: Distance in units.

member.name: M:Unigine.Light.setIntensity(float)
member.summary: Updates the multiplier for the light color used to control color intensity. The higher the value, the brighter the light is. The minimum value of 1 corresponds to the least saturated light color. The maximum value of 100 equals the most bright and intense color.
member.param: New color multiplier.

member.name: M:Unigine.Light.getIntensity const
member.summary: Returns the multiplier of the light color used to control color intensity. The higher the value, the brighter the light is.
member.returns: Light color multiplier.

member.name: M:Unigine.Light.setShadowMask(int)
member.summary: Updates the light mask for the light source. For the shadow from an object's surface to be rendered for the light source, this mask must match the following ones (one bit, at least): Shadow mask of the surface of the object Shadow mask of the material assigned to this surface
member.param: Integer, each bit of which is used to set a mask.

member.name: M:Unigine.Light.getShadowMask const
member.summary: Returns the current light mask for the light source. For the shadow from an object's surface to be rendered for the light source, this mask must match the following ones (one bit, at least): Shadow mask of the surface of the object Shadow mask of the material assigned to this surface
member.returns: Integer, each bit of which is used to set a mask.

member.name: M:Unigine.Light.setRenderTransparent(bool)
member.summary: Enables or disables rendering of the light from the source on transparent objects.
member.param: 1 to render the light from the source on transparent objects, 0 not to render.

member.name: M:Unigine.Light.getRenderTransparent const
member.summary: Returns a value indicating if the light from the source is rendered on transparent objects.
member.returns: 1 if the light from the source is rendered on transparent objects; otherwise, 0.

member.name: M:Unigine.Light.setRenderWater(bool)
member.summary: Enables or disables rendering of the light from the source on water objects.
member.param: 1 to render the light from the source on water objects, 0 not to render.

member.name: M:Unigine.Light.getRenderWater const
member.summary: Returns a value indicating if the light from the source is rendered on water objects.
member.returns: 1 if the light from the source is rendered on water objects; otherwise, 0.

member.name: M:Unigine.Light.setShadow(bool)
member.summary: Updates a value indicating if the light casts shadows from surfaces with the Cast Shadow material.
member.param: 1 to cast shadows, 0 not to cast.

member.name: M:Unigine.Light.getShadow const
member.summary: Returns a value indicating if the light source casts shadows from surfaces with the Cast Shadow material.
member.returns: 1 if the light source casts shadows; otherwise, 0.

member.name: M:Unigine.Light.setShadowBias(float)
member.summary: Updates the constant offset of depth values in a shadow map. If the shadow acne appears, the bias value should be increased. This procedure eliminates the self-shadowing effect, as the points will appear closer to light source when compared to the map depth value. If the bias value is set too high, the shadow will look detached from the object casting it (see the 3rd picture below).
member.param: New constant depth offset. If a negative value is provided, 0 will be used instead.

member.name: M:Unigine.Light.getShadowBias const
member.summary: Returns the constant offset of depth values in a shadow map. If the shadow acne appears, the bias value should be increased. This procedure eliminates the self-shadowing effect, as the points will appear closer to light source when compared to the map depth value. If the bias value is set too high, the shadow will look detached from the object casting it (see the 3rd picture below).
member.returns: Constant depth offset.

member.name: M:Unigine.Light.setShadowDistance(float)
member.summary: Updates a distance, at which shadow from the light source starts fading out to nonexistence.
member.param: Distance in units.

member.name: M:Unigine.Light.getShadowDistance const
member.summary: Returns the current distance, at which shadow from the light source starts fading out to nonexistence.
member.returns: Distance in units.

member.name: M:Unigine.Light.setShadowNormalBias(float)
member.summary: Updates the shadow bias that is achieved by shifting the surface on which the shadow falls. The surface is shifted along normals stored in the normal map. Depending on the normal map of the surface, the shadow may differ for the same values of the normal bias.
member.param: New normal bias. If a negative value is provided, 0 will be used instead.

member.name: M:Unigine.Light.getShadowNormalBias const
member.summary: Returns the shadow bias that is achieved by shifting the surface on which the shadow falls. The surface is shifted along normals stored in the normal map. Depending on the normal map of the surface, the shadow may differ for the same values of the normal bias.
member.returns: The normal bias.

member.name: M:Unigine.Light.setShadowResolution(Light::SHADOW_RESOLUTION)
member.summary: Updates the size of the shadow map created for the light source. The higher the resolution, the smoother and true to life the result is. The lower the resolution, the more blocky and jagged the shadows outline appears.
member.param: an appropriate SHADOW_RESOLUTION_VALUE_ variable.

member.name: M:Unigine.Light.getShadowResolution const
member.summary: Returns the size of the shadow map created for the light source.
member.returns: Shadow map size, one of the SHADOW_RESOLUTION_VALUE_ variables.

member.name: M:Unigine.Light.setShadowScreenSpace(int)
member.summary: Enables or disables screen-space shadows for the light source. When this option is enabled, penumbras from the light source are calculated using the ray tracing algorithm.
member.param: 1 to enable screen-space shadows for the light source, 0 to disable. The default value is 0.

member.name: M:Unigine.Light.getShadowScreenSpace const
member.summary: Returns a value indicating if screen-space shadows for the light source are enabled. When this option is enabled, penumbras from the light source are calculated using the ray tracing algorithm.
member.returns: 1 if screen-space shadows for the light source are enabled; otherwise, 0.

member.name: M:Unigine.Light.setShadowScreenSpaceNoiseRay(float)
member.summary: Sets the intensity of the ray noise used to calculate screen-space shadows for the light source. This parameter is used to reduce the banding effect.
member.param: Ray noise intensity. The default value is 0.5. The higher is the value, the less pronounced is the banding effect. However, this option significantly affects performance.Screen-space shadows must be enabled, see the setShadowScreenSpace() method.

member.name: M:Unigine.Light.getShadowScreenSpaceNoiseRay const
member.summary: Returns the current intensity of the ray noise used to calculate screen-space shadows for the light source.
member.returns: Ray noise intensity.

member.name: M:Unigine.Light.setShadowScreenSpaceNoiseStep(float)
member.summary: Sets the intensity of the step noise used to calculate screen-space shadows for the light source. This parameter is used to reduce the banding effect.
member.param: Step noise intensity. The default value is 0.5. The higher is the value, the less pronounced is the banding effect. However, this option significantly affects performance.Screen-space shadows must be enabled, see the setShadowScreenSpace() method.

member.name: M:Unigine.Light.getShadowScreenSpaceNoiseStep const
member.summary: Returns the current intensity of the step noise used to calculate screen-space shadows for the light source.
member.returns: Step noise intensity.

member.name: M:Unigine.Light.setShadowScreenSpaceNumRays(int)
member.summary: Sets the number of rays used to calculate screen-space shadows for the light source.
member.param: Number of rays. The default value is 8. The higher is the value, the better is the quality of shadows. However, this option significantly affects performance.Screen-space shadows must be enabled, see the setShadowScreenSpace() method.

member.name: M:Unigine.Light.getShadowScreenSpaceNumRays const
member.summary: Returns the current number of rays used to calculate screen-space shadows for the light source.
member.returns: Number of rays.

member.name: M:Unigine.Light.setShadowScreenSpaceNumSteps(int)
member.summary: Sets the number of steps used to calculate screen-space shadows for the light source.
member.param: Number of steps. The default value is 8. The higher is the value, the better is the quality of shadows. However, this option significantly affects performance.Screen-space shadows must be enabled, see the setShadowScreenSpace() method.

member.name: M:Unigine.Light.getShadowScreenSpaceNumSteps const
member.summary: Returns the current number of steps used to calculate screen-space shadows for the light source.
member.returns: Number of steps.

member.name: M:Unigine.Light.setShadowScreenSpaceSoftness(float)
member.summary: Returns the softness value of the screen-space shadows for the light source.
member.param: Screen-space shadows softness. The default value is 0.4. The higher is the value, the softer are the shadows.Screen-space shadows must be enabled, see the setShadowScreenSpace() method.

member.name: M:Unigine.Light.getShadowScreenSpaceSoftness const
member.summary: Returns the current softness value of the screen-space shadows for the light source.
member.returns: Screen-space shadows softness.

member.name: M:Unigine.Light.setShadowScreenSpaceStepSizeNear(float)
member.summary: Sets the size of the step used to calculate screen-space shadows for the light source (close distance range). This parameter can be used to adjust calculation of shadows for specific sizes of objects. You can set different Step Size and Threshold values for objects located near the camera and far away from it. Thus, full-scale shadows will be rendered for large objects located far away, while within the close distance range only shadows cast by small objects will be rendered. This feature is especially useful for locations where details are required for both short and long-distance ranges.
member.param: Screen-space step size for close distance range. The default value is 0.5.Screen-space shadows must be enabled, see the setShadowScreenSpace() method.

member.name: M:Unigine.Light.getShadowScreenSpaceStepSizeNear const
member.summary: Returns the current size of the step used to calculate screen-space shadows for the light source (close distance range). This parameter can be used to adjust calculation of shadows for specific sizes of objects. You can set different Step Size and Threshold values for objects located near the camera and far away from it. Thus, full-scale shadows will be rendered for large objects located far away, while within the close distance range only shadows cast by small objects will be rendered. This feature is especially useful for locations where details are required for both short and long-distance ranges.
member.returns: Screen-space step size for close distance range. The default value is 0.5.Screen-space shadows must be enabled, see the setShadowScreenSpace() method.

member.name: M:Unigine.Light.setShadowScreenSpaceStepSizeFar(float)
member.summary: Sets the current size of the step used to calculate screen-space shadows for the light source (long distance range). This parameter can be used to adjust calculation of shadows for specific sizes of objects. You can set different Step Size and Threshold values for objects located near the camera and far away from it. Thus, full-scale shadows will be rendered for large objects located far away, while within the close distance range only shadows cast by small objects will be rendered. This feature is especially useful for locations where details are required for both short and long-distance ranges.
member.param: Screen-space step size for long distance range. The default value is 0.5.Screen-space shadows must be enabled, see the setShadowScreenSpace() method.

member.name: M:Unigine.Light.getShadowScreenSpaceStepSizeFar const
member.summary: Returns the current size of the step used to calculate screen-space shadows for the light source (long distance range). This parameter can be used to adjust calculation of shadows for specific sizes of objects. You can set different Step Size and Threshold values for objects located near the camera and far away from it. Thus, full-scale shadows will be rendered for large objects located far away, while within the close distance range only shadows cast by small objects will be rendered. This feature is especially useful for locations where details are required for both short and long-distance ranges.
member.returns: Screen-space step size for long distance range. The default value is 0.5.Screen-space shadows must be enabled, see the setShadowScreenSpace() method.

member.name: M:Unigine.Light.setShadowScreenSpaceThresholdNear(float)
member.summary: Sets the threshold value used to calculate screen-space shadows for the light source (close distance range). This parameter is used to adjust the look of screen-space shadows. You can set different Step Size and Threshold values for objects located near the camera and far away from it. Thus, full-scale shadows will be rendered for large objects located far away, while within the close distance range only shadows cast by small objects will be rendered. This feature is especially useful for locations where details are required for both short and long-distance ranges.
member.param: Screen-space shadows threshold for close distance range. The default value is 1.0.Screen-space shadows must be enabled, see the setShadowScreenSpace() method.

member.name: M:Unigine.Light.getShadowScreenSpaceThresholdNear const
member.summary: Returns the current threshold value used to calculate screen-space shadows for the light source (close distance range). You can set different Step Size and Threshold values for objects located near the camera and far away from it. Thus, full-scale shadows will be rendered for large objects located far away, while within the close distance range only shadows cast by small objects will be rendered. This feature is especially useful for locations where details are required for both short and long-distance ranges.
member.returns: Screen-space shadows threshold for close distance range.

member.name: M:Unigine.Light.setShadowScreenSpaceThresholdFar(float)
member.summary: Sets the threshold value used to calculate screen-space shadows for the light source (long distance range). This parameter is used to adjust the look of screen-space shadows.You can set different Step Size and Threshold values for objects located near the camera and far away from it. Thus, full-scale shadows will be rendered for large objects located far away, while within the close distance range only shadows cast by small objects will be rendered. This feature is especially useful for locations where details are required for both short and long-distance ranges.
member.param: Screen-space shadows threshold for long distance range. The default value is 1.0.Screen-space shadows must be enabled, see the setShadowScreenSpace() method.

member.name: M:Unigine.Light.getShadowScreenSpaceThresholdFar const
member.summary: Returns the current threshold value used to calculate screen-space shadows for the light source (long distance range). You can set different Step Size and Threshold values for objects located near the camera and far away from it. Thus, full-scale shadows will be rendered for large objects located far away, while within the close distance range only shadows cast by small objects will be rendered. This feature is especially useful for locations where details are required for both short and long-distance ranges.
member.returns: Screen-space shadows threshold for long distance range.

member.name: M:Unigine.Light.setViewportMask(int)
member.summary: Updates a bit mask for rendering into the viewport. The light is rendered, if its mask matches the player's one.
member.param: Integer, each bit of which is used to set a mask.

member.name: M:Unigine.Light.getViewportMask const
member.summary: Returns the current bit mask for rendering into the viewport. The light is rendered, if its mask matches the player's one.
member.returns: Integer, each bit of which is used to set a mask.

member.name: M:Unigine.Light.setVisibleDistance(float)
member.summary: Updates a distance, at which the light source starts fading. If the distance is set to infinity, the source is always rendered.
member.param: Distance in units.

member.name: M:Unigine.Light.getVisibleDistance const
member.summary: Returns the current distance, at which the light source starts fading. If the distance is set to infinity, the source is always rendered.
member.returns: Distance in units.

member.name: M:Unigine.Light.setLensFlaresEnabled(bool)
member.summary: Enables or disables the per-light lens flare effect for the light source. This feature is available only for: Omni Lights, Projected Lights and World Lights. The maximum number of per-light lens flares that can be rendered is 32.
member.param: 1 to enable the per-light lens flare effect for the light source, 0 to disable. The default value is 0.

member.name: M:Unigine.Light.isLensFlaresEnabled const
member.summary: Returns a value indicating if the per-light lens flare effect is enabled for the light source. This feature is available only for: Omni Lights, Projected Lights and World Lights.
member.returns: 1 if the per-light lens flare effect for the light source is enabled; otherwise, 0.

member.name: M:Unigine.Light.allocateLensFlares(int)
member.summary: Allocate a buffer for a given number of lens flares to be created. With this function, memory can be allocated once rather than in chunks, making the creation faster. The lens flare effect must be enabled for the light source. This feature is available only for: Omni Lights, Projected Lights and World Lights.
member.param: Number of lens flares to be created in the allocated buffer.

member.name: M:Unigine.Light.addLensFlare
member.summary: Add a new lens flare for the per-light lens flare effect. The lens flare effect must be enabled for the light source. This feature is available only for: Omni Lights, Projected Lights and World Lights.

member.name: M:Unigine.Light.getLensFlare(int)
member.summary: Returns the given lens flare from the list of the ones used for the per-light lens flare effect. The lens flare effect must be enabled for the light source. This feature is available only for: Omni Lights, Projected Lights and World Lights.
member.param: Lens flare number.
member.returns: Light lens flare smart pointer.

member.name: M:Unigine.Light.cloneLensFlare(int)
member.summary: Creates a clone of the lens flare with a given number in the list of lens flares used for the per-light lens flare effect. The lens flare effect must be enabled for the light source. This feature is available only for: Omni Lights, Projected Lights and World Lights.
member.param: Number of lens flare to be cloned.

member.name: M:Unigine.Light.removeLensFlare(int)
member.summary: Removes the lens flare with a given number from the list of lens flares used for the per-light lens flare effect. The lens flare effect must be enabled for the light source. This feature is available only for: Omni Lights, Projected Lights and World Lights.
member.param: Number of lens flare to be removed.

member.name: M:Unigine.Light.getNumLensFlares const
member.summary: Returns the total number of lens flares used for the per-light lens flare effect. The lens flare effect must be enabled for the light source. This feature is available only for: Omni Lights, Projected Lights and World Lights.
member.returns: Number of lens flares used for the per-light lens flare effect.

member.name: M:Unigine.Light.clearLensFlares
member.summary: Clears the list of lens flares used for the per-light lens flare effect. The lens flare effect must be enabled for the light source. This feature is available only for: Omni Lights, Projected Lights and World Lights.

member.name: M:Unigine.Light.setLensFlaresIntensity(float)
member.summary: Sets the intensity of per-light lens flares. The lens flare effect must be enabled for the light source. This feature is available only for: Omni Lights, Projected Lights and World Lights.
member.param: Intensity of per-light lens flares.Higher values make the effect more pronounced.

member.name: M:Unigine.Light.getLensFlaresIntensity const
member.summary: Returns the current intensity of per-light lens flares. The lens flare effect must be enabled for the light source. This feature is available only for: Omni Lights, Projected Lights and World Lights.
member.returns: Intensity of per-light lens flares.Higher values make the effect more pronounced.

member.name: M:Unigine.Light.setLensFlaresUseLightColor(bool)
member.summary: Enables or disables light color modulation for per-light lens flares. When enabled, the lens flares will have the same color as the light source. The lens flare effect must be enabled for the light source. This feature is available only for: Omni Lights, Projected Lights and World Lights.
member.param: 1 to enable light color modulation for the per-light lens flare effect, 0 to disable. The default value is 0.

member.name: M:Unigine.Light.isLensFlaresUseLightColor const
member.summary: Returns a value indicating if light color modulation is enabled for per-light lens flares. When enabled, the lens flares will have the same color as the light source. The lens flare effect must be enabled for the light source. This feature is available only for: Omni Lights, Projected Lights and World Lights.
member.returns: 1 if light color modulation for per-light lens flares is enabled; otherwise, 0.

member.name: M:Unigine.Light.setLensFlaresOcclusionFade(float)
member.summary: Sets the lens flare occlusion fade value for the cases when the light source becomes occluded by an object. The lens flare effect must be enabled for the light source. This feature is available only for: Omni Lights, Projected Lights and World Lights.
member.param: Lens flare occlusion fade value in the range [0.0f; 1.0f]. By the value of 0.0f, lens flares disappear abruptly, as the light source becomes occluded by an object. If 1.0f is set, lens flares will fade out gradually.

member.name: M:Unigine.Light.getLensFlaresOcclusionFade const
member.summary: Returns the current lens flare occlusion fade value for the cases when the light source becomes occluded by an object. The lens flare effect must be enabled for the light source. This feature is available only for: Omni Lights, Projected Lights and World Lights.
member.returns: Current lens flare occlusion fade value in the range [0.0f; 1.0f]. By the value of 0.0f, lens flares disappear abruptly, as the light source becomes occluded by an object. If 1.0f is set, lens flares will fade out gradually.

member.name: M:Unigine.Light.setLensFlaresOcclusionFadeBorder(float)
member.summary: Sets the lens flare occlusion fade value for the cases when the light source becomes occluded by the edges of the screen. The lens flare effect must be enabled for the light source. This feature is available only for: Omni Lights, Projected Lights and World Lights.
member.param: Lens flare occlusion fade value in the range [0.0f; 1.0f]. By the value of 0.0f, lens flares disappear abruptly, as the light source becomes occluded by an object. If 1.0f is set, lens flares will fade out gradually.

member.name: M:Unigine.Light.getLensFlaresOcclusionFadeBorder const
member.summary: Returns the current lens flare occlusion fade value for the cases when the light source becomes occluded by the edges of the screen. The lens flare effect must be enabled for the light source. This feature is available only for: Omni Lights, Projected Lights and World Lights.
member.returns: Current lens flare occlusion fade value in the range [0.0f; 1.0f]. By the value of 0.0f, lens flares disappear abruptly, as the light source becomes occluded by the edges of the screen. If 1.0f is set, lens flares will fade out gradually.

member.name: M:Unigine.Light.setLensFlaresWorldPositionOffset(Unigine.Math.vec3)
member.summary: Sets the offset from the world position of the light source for the per-light lens flares. Offset is not available for World Lights. The lens flare effect must be enabled for the light source. This feature is available only for: Omni Lights, Projected Lights and World Lights.
member.param: Vector representing the offset of lens flares from the light source world position.

member.name: M:Unigine.Light.getLensFlaresWorldPositionOffset const
member.summary: Returns the current offset from the world position of the light source for the per-light lens flares. Offset is not available for World Lights. The lens flare effect must be enabled for the light source. This feature is available only for: Omni Lights, Projected Lights and World Lights.
member.returns: Vector representing the current offset of lens flares from the light source world position.

member.name: M:Unigine.Light.setLensFlaresTextureName(char)
member.summary: Sets the name of the texture to be used for the per-light lens flare effect. This texture stores images for all lens flares used to render lens flares. The lens flare effect must be enabled for the light source. This feature is available only for: Omni Lights, Projected Lights and World Lights.
member.param: Texture name.

member.name: M:Unigine.Light.getLensFlaresTextureName const
member.summary: Returns the name of the texture currently used for the per-light lens flare effect. This texture stores images for all lens flares used to render lens flares. The lens flare effect must be enabled for the light source. This feature is available only for: Omni Lights, Projected Lights and World Lights.
member.returns: Texture name.

member.name: M:Unigine.Light.setLux(float)
member.summary: Sets an intensity of a light color (as perceived by the human eye) in lux. In UNIGINE, all light sources have the intensity of 1 by default, which is equal to 100000 lux.

member.name: M:Unigine.Light.getLux const
member.summary: Returns the intensity of the light color (as perceived by the human eye) in lux. In UNIGINE, all light sources have the intensity of 1 by default, which is equal to 100000 lux.
member.returns: Light color intensity, lux.

member.name: M:Unigine.Light.setColorTemperature(float)

member.name: M:Unigine.Light.getColorTemperature const

member.name: M:Unigine.Light.calculateFinalColor const
member.summary: Calculates the final color of the light source depending on the calculation mode used.
member.returns: Resulting color of the light source.

member.name: M:Unigine.Light.setBakedDepthTexturePath(char)

member.name: M:Unigine.Light.getBakedDepthTexturePath const

member.returns: Path to a baked depth texture to be used.

member.name: M:Unigine.Light.setShadowMode(Light::SHADOW_MODE)
member.summary: Sets shadow mode for the light source in static mode. This shadow mode should be aligned with the shadow mode of the object surface in order to make this surface cast a shadow from the light source.
member.param: Shadow mode of the light in static mode, one of the SHADOW_MODE_* variables.

member.name: M:Unigine.Light.getShadowMode const
member.summary: Returns shadow mode for the light source in static mode. This shadow mode should be aligned with the shadow mode of the object surface in order to make this surface cast a shadow from the light source.
member.returns: Shadow mode of the light source in static mode, one of the SHADOW_MODE_* variables.

member.name: M:Unigine.Light.setShadowColorTextureMode(Light::SHADOW_COLOR_MODE)
member.summary: Sets the type of texture used to define light distribution. This feature is available only for Omni Lights and Projected Lights. See description of the modes in the corresponding articles forOmni Lights and Projected Lights.
member.param: One of the following modes:SHADOW_COLOR_MODE_IES - Light distibution is defined by the IES profile.SHADOW_COLOR_MODE_SIMPLE - An arbitrary 2D texture is projected onto the scene.

member.name: M:Unigine.Light.getShadowColorTextureMode const

member.name: M:Unigine.Light.setDynamicDepthTexture(Unigine.Ptr{Unigine.Texture})

member.name: M:Unigine.Light.getDynamicDepthTexture const

member.name: M:Unigine.Light.getBakedDepthTexture const

member.name: M:Unigine.Light.setShadowFilterMode(Light::SHADOW_FILTER)
member.summary: Sets the filtering mode to be used to reduce the stair-step effect for soft shadows making the edges smoother.
member.param: Filtering mode to be used for shadows rendering, one of the SHADOW_FILTER_* variables.

member.name: M:Unigine.Light.getShadowFilterMode const

member.name: M:Unigine.Light.setShadowFilter(float)
member.summary: Sets filtering intensity for the selected mode. This value is ignored when filtering mode is set to disabled.
member.param: Filtering intensity for the selected mode. The higher the value the less noticeable the stair-step effect at the edges of shadows will be. The default value is 1.0f.

member.name: M:Unigine.Light.setShadowPenumbraMode(Light::SHADOW_PENUMBRA)
member.summary: Sets the global quality mode to be used for rendering penumbra from the light source. This mode enables simulation of real-world shadows by keeping sharp contact shadows closer to the base and softening the farther the shadow stretches away. Higher values produce softer shadows. The default value is SHADOW_PENUMBRA_GLOBAL.
member.param: Quality mode used for penumbra rendering, one of the SHADOW_PENUMBRA_* variables.

member.name: M:Unigine.Light.getShadowPenumbraMode const
member.summary: Returns the current global quality mode used for rendering penumbra from the light source. This mode enables simulation of real-world shadows by keeping sharp contact shadows closer to the base and softening the farther the shadow stretches away. Higher values produce softer shadows. The default value is SHADOW_PENUMBRA_GLOBAL.
member.returns: Current quality mode used for penumbra rendering, one of the SHADOW_PENUMBRA_* variables.

member.name: M:Unigine.Light.setShadowPenumbra(float)
member.summary: Sets intensity of penumbra for the selected mode. This value is ignored when penumbra rendering mode is set to disabled.
member.param: Intensity of penumbra for the selected mode:Low values correspond to sharper shadow edges.Higher values increase penumbra size.The default value is0.0f.

member.name: M:Unigine.Light.getShadowPenumbra const
member.summary: Returns the current intensity of penumbra for the selected mode.
member.returns: Current intensity of penumbra for the selected mode:Low values correspond to sharper shadow edges.Higher values increase penumbra size.The default value is0.0f.

member.name: M:Unigine.Light.setShadowScreenSpaceStepSizeFarDistance(float)
member.summary: Sets the distance from the camera after which the Far Step Size shall be used for screen-space shadows calculation. You can set different Step Size and Threshold values for objects located near the camera and far away from it. Thus, full-scale shadows will be rendered for large objects located far away, while within the close distance range only shadows cast by small objects will be rendered. This feature is especially useful for locations where details are required for both short and long-distance ranges.
member.param: Distance from the camera (in units) after which the Far Step Size shall be used for screen-space shadows calculation. For the space between Near Step Size Distance and Far Step Size Distance, the step size value is interpolated from Near Step Size to Far Step Size.

member.name: M:Unigine.Light.getShadowScreenSpaceStepSizeFarDistance const
member.summary: Returns the current distance from the camera after which the Far Step Size is used for screen-space shadows calculation. You can set different Step Size and Threshold values for objects located near the camera and far away from it. Thus, full-scale shadows will be rendered for large objects located far away, while within the close distance range only shadows cast by small objects will be rendered. This feature is especially useful for locations where details are required for both short and long-distance ranges.
member.returns: Distance from the camera (in units) after which the Far Step Size shall be used for screen-space shadows calculation. For the space between Near Step Size Distance and Far Step Size Distance, the step size value is interpolated from Near Step Size to Far Step Size.

member.param: Distance from the camera (in units) up to which the Near Step Size shall be used for screen-space shadows calculation.

member.name: M:Unigine.Light.setShadowScreenSpaceTranslucentDepth(float)
member.summary: Sets the Translucent Depth value for Screen-Space Shadows indicating how much the light passes through screen-space shadows on translucent materials (with Translucence option enabled).
member.param: New Translucent Depth value to be set for Screen-Space Shadows: The higher the value the deeper the light penetrates translucent objects shifting the shadow.

member.name: M:Unigine.Light.getShadowScreenSpaceTranslucentDepth const
member.summary: Returns the current Translucent Depth value for Screen-Space Shadows indicating how much the light passes through screen-space shadows on translucent materials (with Translucence option enabled).
member.returns: Current Translucent Depth value set for Screen-Space Shadows: The higher the value the deeper the light penetrates translucent objects shifting the shadow.

member.name: M:Unigine.Light.setShadowScreenSpaceTranslucentDepthPerspectiveCompensation(float)
member.summary: Sets a new Perspective Compensation value for Screen-Space Shadows, that defines whether the Translucent Depth parameter depends on the distance from the camera to the surface or not. This effect is used to make tree crowns located far from the camera more translucent than the grass nearby.
member.param: New Perspective Compensation value to be set for the Translucent Depth parameter of Screen-Space Shadows: 0 - the Translucent Depth value does not depend on the distance from the camera to the surface.1 - the Translucent Depth value linearly depends on the distance from the camera to the surface.

member.name: M:Unigine.Light.getShadowScreenSpaceTranslucentDepthPerspectiveCompensation const
member.summary: Returns the current Perspective Compensation value for Screen-Space Shadows, that defines whether the Translucent Depth parameter depends on the distance from the camera to the surface or not. This effect is used to make tree crowns located far from the camera more translucent than the grass nearby.
member.returns: Current Perspective Compensation value set for the Translucent Depth parameter of Screen-Space Shadows: 0 - the Translucent Depth value does not depend on the distance from the camera to the surface.1 - the Translucent Depth value linearly depends on the distance from the camera to the surface.

member.name: M:Unigine.Light.setShadowScreenSpaceTranslucentViewBias(float)
member.summary: Sets a new View Bias value for Screen-Space Shadows, that controls an effect of fuzziness for vegetation (e.g. simulating leaves of saintpaulia or providing a sponge-like look for tree crowns).
member.param: New View Bias value to be set for Screen-Space Shadows: By the value of 0 the effect is disabledthe value of 1 corresponds to the maximum effect.

member.name: M:Unigine.Light.getShadowScreenSpaceTranslucentViewBias const
member.summary: Returns the current Translucent View Bias value for Screen-Space Shadows, that controls an effect of fuzziness for vegetation (e.g. simulating leaves of saintpaulia or providing a sponge-like look for tree crowns).
member.returns: Current Translucent View Bias value for Screen-Space Shadows: By the value of 0 the effect is disabledthe value of 1 corresponds to the maximum effect.

member.summary: Classic color calculation mode, resulting color is defined by Color.

member.name: F:Unigine.Light.MODE_DYNAMIC
member.summary: Real-time light rendering mode. The light source with this mode enabled is turned off while light baking is being calculated. Objects lit by such light cast only dynamic shadows.

member.name: F:Unigine.Light.MODE_STATIC
member.summary: Mixed light rendering mode. The light source with this light mode enabled contributes to light baking and remains enabled all the time providing direct realtime lighting. Objects lit by such light can cast static or dynamic shadows depending on the shadow mode set for the source and the object surface.

member.name: M:Unigine.LightEnvironmentProbe.setParallax(float)
member.summary: Sets parallax correction value for reflection cubemaps projected by the environment probe. By the minimum value of 0 reflection cubemaps are simply projected onto objects, and do not follow the viewer's perspective. This causes an unrealistic-looking reflection for most surfaces. Parallax correction enables to take camera's position into account. Parallax correction is not available for reflections on transparent objects.
member.param: Parallax correction value to be set for reflection cubemaps projected by the environment probe in the range [0;1]:By the minimum value of 0 parallax correction is disabled (reflections will look like objects are infinitely distant).By the maximum value of 1 parallax correction is enabled (reflections will look like objects are at the distance close to the radius of the environment probe).Values in-between represent a linear interpolation factor for parallax correction and are to be set when the environment probe is used to fit a medium or small object into the environment for additional correction.

member.name: M:Unigine.LightEnvironmentProbe.getParallax const
member.summary: Returns the current parallax correction value for reflection cubemaps projected by the environment probe. By the minimum value of 0 reflection cubemaps are simply projected onto objects, and do not follow the viewer's perspective. This causes an unrealistic-looking reflection for most surfaces. Parallax correction enables to take camera's position into account. Parallax correction is not available for reflections on transparent objects.
member.returns: Current parallax correction value for reflection cubemaps projected by the environment probe in the range [0;1].By the minimum value of 0 parallax correction is disabled (reflections will look like objects are infinitely distant).By the maximum value of 1 parallax correction is enabled (reflections will look like objects are at the distance close to the radius of the environment probe).Values in-between represent a linear interpolation factor for parallax correction and are to be set when the environment probe is used to fit a medium or small object into the environment for additional correction.

member.name: M:Unigine.LightEnvironmentProbe.setRenderFacesPerFrame(int)
member.summary: Sets the update interval for the cube texture used for dynamic reflections.
member.param: Update interval for the dynamic cube texture. The available values are:1 - refresh only one face each frame.2 - refresh 2 faces each frame.3 - refresh 3 faces each frame.4 - refresh 4 faces each frame.5 - refresh 5 faces each frame.6 - refresh 6 faces each frame.

member.name: M:Unigine.LightEnvironmentProbe.getRenderFacesPerFrame const
member.summary: Returns the current update interval set for the cube texture used for dynamic reflections.
member.returns: Update interval for the dynamic cube texture. The available values are:1 - refresh only one face each frame.2 - refresh 2 faces each frame.3 - refresh 3 faces each frame.4 - refresh 4 faces each frame.5 - refresh 5 faces each frame.6 - refresh 6 faces each frame.

member.name: M:Unigine.LightVoxelProbe.getVideoMemoryUsage
member.summary: Returns a value defining how much memory the light texture takes according to its size. The memory is calculated in accordance to the following formula: Memory = SizeX SizeY SizeZ Sides FormatMemory SizeX, SizeY, SizeZ - the dimensions of the 3D light texture, in voxels. Sides - number of sides of each voxel, equal to 6. FormatMemory - a memory usage amount for the texture in RGBA16 format, equal to 8.
member.returns: A texture memory usage, in bytes.

member.name: M:Unigine.LightVoxelProbe.setAdditiveBlending(bool)
member.summary: Enables or disables additive blending mode for the voxel probe. This option offers more flexibility in lighting control. You can use it to blend lighting of several voxel probes together and control them separately (e.g. make a separate voxel probe for an indoor emissive light source and blend it with another voxel probe with lighting baked from the sky, having the ability to enable and disable them separately). Voxel probes with additive blending enabled cannot be used to add lighting details (e.g. creating a small high-detail voxel probe inside a large low-detail one). Such probes do not replace each other, as they are blended instead.
member.param: 1 to enable additive blending mode for the voxel probe; 0 to disable it.

member.name: M:Unigine.LightVoxelProbe.isAdditiveBlending const
member.summary: Returns a value indicating if the additive blending mode for the voxel probe is enabled. This option offers more flexibility in lighting control. You can use it to blend lighting of several voxel probes together and control them separately (e.g. make a separate voxel probe for an indoor emissive light source and blend it with another voxel probe with lighting baked from the sky, having the ability to enable and disable them separately). Voxel probes with additive blending enabled cannot be used to add lighting details (e.g. creating a small high-detail voxel probe inside a large low-detail one). Such probes do not replace each other, as they are blended instead.
member.returns: 1 if the additive blending mode for the voxel probe; otherwise, 0.

member.param: 1 to enable baking of omni light sources to the voxel probe; 0 to disable it.

You can use this option together with additive blending to provide more flexibility in light baking. Thus, you can make voxel probes independent of each other and combine them to produce some sort of dynamic GI effect.
member.returns: 1 if omni light sources are to be baked to the voxel probe; otherwise, 0.

member.name: F:Unigine.LightVoxelProbe.BAKE_QUALITY_MEDIUM

member.name: F:Unigine.LightVoxelProbe.BAKE_QUALITY_DRAFT

member.name: M:Unigine.LightOmni.getSize const
member.summary: Returns the size of the area illuminated by the light source. Depending on the shape type, the size varies: If the light is point-shaped, each component of the vector will be equal to the attenuation distance: If the light is spherical, each component of the vector will be equal to the attenuation distance + sphere radius: If the light is capsule-shaped, the 1st component of the vector will be equal to attenuation distance + capsule length: If the light is rectangular, the 2nd component of the vector will be equal to attenuation distance + rectangle height:
member.returns: A size of the illuminated area.

member.name: M:Unigine.LightProj.setIESRelativeToFov(bool)
member.summary: Sets a value indicating if IES texture is scaled to fit within the light source's Field of View. Works only when light's distibution is defined by an IES profile (color texture parameter is set to IES), a lighting industry standard of describing how the light is cast based on real-world measured light fixtures.
member.param: true - to enable scaling of IES texture to fit within the light source's Field of View; false - to disable.

member.name: M:Unigine.LightProj.isIESRelativeToFov const
member.summary: Returns a value indicating if IES texture is scaled to fit within the light source's Field of View. Works only when light's distibution is defined by an IES profile (color texture parameter is set to IES), a lighting industry standard of describing how the light is cast based on real-world measured light fixtures.
member.returns: true if IES texture is scaled to fit within the light source's Field of View; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:Unigine.LightWorld.setNumShadowCascades(int)
member.summary: Sets the number of shadow cascades with different shadow maps. All the shadow maps have the same resolution, but are applied to different cascades. Thus, close-range shadows are of higher quality and distant ones of lower.
member.param: Number of shadow cascades. Accepted values are from 1 to 4. The default is 4.

member.name: M:Unigine.LightWorld.getNumShadowCascades
member.summary: Returns the number of shadow cascades with different shadow maps. All the shadow maps have the same resolution, but are applied to different cascades. Thus, close-range shadows are of higher quality and distant ones of lower.
member.returns: The number of shadow cascades. The minimum number of cascades is 1, the maximum is 4.

member.summary: Sets a lighting type for the world light.
member.param: One of the SCATTERING_* variables.

member.name: M:Unigine.LightWorld.getScattering
member.summary: Returns a lighting type set for the world light.

member.name: M:Unigine.LightWorld.setShadowCascadeMode(int)
member.summary: Sets the shadow cascade generation mode for the world light source. There are two modes available: Dynamic - shadow cascades are built dynamically relative to the camera's position. Static - shadow cascades are built relative to the world light's position and baked. This mode is suitable for archviz projects.
member.param: Shadow cascade mode, one of the SHADOW_CASCADE_MODE_* variables.

member.name: M:Unigine.LightWorld.getShadowCascadeMode
member.summary: Returns the current shadow cascade generation mode for the world light source. There are two modes available: Dynamic - shadow cascades are built dynamically relative to the camera's position. Static - shadow cascades are built relative to the world light's position and baked. This mode is suitable for archviz projects.
member.returns: Shadow cascade mode, one of the SHADOW_CASCADE_MODE_* variables.

member.summary: Sets the multiplier for the distance to the border of the specified shadow cascade at which the corresponding shadows are rendered.
member.param: Number of the cascade in range [0;num_cascades-1].
Distance multiplier to be set, in range [0; 1].

member.name: M:Unigine.LightWorld.getShadowCascadeBorder(int)
member.summary: Returns the multiplier for the distance to the border of the specified shadow cascade at which the corresponding shadows are rendered.
member.param: Number of the cascade in range [0;num_cascades-1].
member.returns: Current distance multiplier, in range [0;1].

member.name: M:Unigine.LightWorld.setShadowHeight(float)
member.summary: Sets the view height of the orthographic projection used for generation of static shadow cascades. Static cascades are generated relative to the world light's position. This parameter is available only when the shadow cascade mode of the world light is set to static.

member.name: M:Unigine.LightWorld.getShadowHeight

member.returns: Current view height of the orthographic projection used for shadow cascade generation, in units.

member.param: View width of the orthographic projection used for shadow cascade generation, in units.

member.name: M:Unigine.LightWorld.getShadowWidth

member.returns: Current view width of the orthographic projection used for shadow cascade generation, in units.

member.summary: Sets the distance to the far clipping plane to be used for generation of static shadow cascades. Static cascades are generated relative to the world light's position. This parameter is available only when the shadow cascade mode of the world light is set to static.

member.name: F:Unigine.LightWorld.SCATTERING_MOON
member.summary: Render the atmosphere in accordance with the Moon's lighting.

member.name: F:Unigine.LightWorld.SCATTERING_NONE
member.summary: Render the atmosphere with no influence of the global lights (sun and moon), i.e. the light gradient won't be changed in any direction.

member.name: F:Unigine.LightWorld.SCATTERING_SUN
member.summary: Render the atmosphere in accordance with the Sun's lighting.

member.name: F:Unigine.LightWorld.SHADOW_CASCADE_MODE_STATIC
member.summary: Static shadow cascade generation mode. In this mode shadow cascades are built and baked relative to the light source's position. This mode is suitable as a performance optimization technique for small-area ArchViz projects where shadow cascades can be divided into 2 sections: walkable area with high-resolution shadows (as they're observed closely) and non-walkable area with low-resolution shadows (as they're observed from a distance). Changing the time of day is not available in this mode, as shadow cascades are baked.

member.name: F:Unigine.LightWorld.SHADOW_CASCADE_MODE_DYNAMIC
member.summary: Dynamic shadow cascade generation mode. In this mode shadow cascades are built dynamically relative to the camera's position. All shadows are calculated dynamically making it possible to change the time of day (day-night cycle).

member.name: M:Unigine.LightLensFlare.setIntensity(float)
member.summary: Sets a new intensity value for the lens flare billboard.
member.param: Billboard intensity to be set. The color of the billboard is multiplied by this value. The higher the value, the brighter the flare will be.

member.name: M:Unigine.LightLensFlare.getIntensity
member.summary: Returns the current intensity of the lens flare billboard.
member.returns: Current billboard intensity. The color of the billboard is multiplied by this value. The higher the value, the brighter the flare will be.

member.name: M:Unigine.LightLensFlare.setOffset(float)
member.summary: Sets a new offset value for the lens flare billboard. The offset determines the distance from the light source along the vector oriented from the light source to the screen center.
member.param: Billboard offset value to be set. The lower the absolute value is, the closer to the light source the billboard will be. Negative values indicate that the distance is measured in the opposite direction.

member.name: M:Unigine.LightLensFlare.getOffset
member.summary: Returns the current offset value for the lens flare billboard. It is the offset from the light source along the direction of the light ray.
member.returns: Current billboard offset value. The lower the absolute value is, the closer to the light source the billboard will be. Negative values indicate that the distance is measured in the opposite direction.

member.name: M:Unigine.LightLensFlare.setOffsetScale(float)
member.summary: Sets the offset-dependent scale factor for the lens flare billboard.
member.param: Scale factor to be used. As the offset from the light source increases:values less than 1.0f will make the billboard shrink.values greater than 1.0f will make the billboard grow.

member.name: M:Unigine.LightLensFlare.getOffsetScale
member.summary: Returns the current offset-dependent scale factor for the lens flare billboard.
member.returns: Current scale factor. As the offset from the light source increases:values less than 1.0f will make the billboard shrink.values greater than 1.0f will make the billboard grow.

member.name: M:Unigine.LightLensFlare.setRotate(int)
member.summary: Enables or disables rotation of the lens flare billboard. When enabled the top of the billboard will always face the center of the screen.
member.param: 1 to rotation of the lens flare billboard, 0 to disable. The default value is 0.

member.name: M:Unigine.LightLensFlare.isRotate
